aircraft.value: Falcon Prime - AC-5869-772 at Maintenance Hub-Y

defect_observed.value: Actuator seal leakage. Abnormality observed during system test.

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Brake System component. Physical examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.

corrective_action.value: Adjust calibration settings to manufacturer specifications

preventive_action.value: Modify design to incorporate additional safety margin

remarks_investigation.value: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.

remarks_design.value: Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol. Date: 15/12/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Air Cmde S.B. Rao

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type. Date: 16/12/2024 Signature: Eng. R.P. Singh

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) Fleet experience reviewed. Similar occurrences noted on other platforms. Support fleet-wide inspection. Date: 19/12/2024 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval. Date: 20/12/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) From regulatory standpoint, investigation meets required standards. Approve proposed corrective actions. Date: 23/12/2024 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao

Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Actuator seal leakage. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Age-related degradation of elastomeric components
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Brake System component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Adjust calibration settings to manufacturer specifications
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Modify design to incorporate additional safety margin
d) Attributable Code: M - Other Reasons
Remarks: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.
